sen.j: 円派（えんぱ）は、 平安時代中期から鎌倉時代の仏師の一派。
sen.e: Enpa is a school of busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues) which started from the mid Heian period and lasted until the Kamakura period.
Enpa is a school of busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues) which started from the mid Heian period and lasted until the Kamakura period.
Enpa is a school of busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues) which started from the mid Heian period and lasted until the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 祖は定朝の弟子長勢、三条仏所を形成し京都を中心に活躍。
sen.e: The founder was Chose who established Sanjo Bussho and engaged in activities around Kyoto, who was a disciple of Jocho.
The founder was Chose, who established Sanjo Bussho and engaged in activities around Kyoto, and was a disciple of Jocho.
The founder was Chosei, who established Sanjo Bussho and engaged in activities around Kyoto, and was a disciple of Jocho.

sen.j: 明円以降、奈良、鎌倉に主流が移り衰微。
sen.e: In the time of Myoen and on, the mainstream of the school was moved to Nara and Kamakura, and the school was declined.
In the time of Myoen and on, the mainstream of the school was moved to Nara and Kamakura, and the school declined.
In the time of Myoen and on, the mainstream of the school was moved to Nara and Kamakura, and the school declined.

sen.j: 円の字をもつ仏師が多いため、後世に名づけられた。
sen.e: Because mamy of the busshi had the name with the letter En, the school was named so afterward.
Because mamy of the busshi had the name with the letter En, the school was named so afterward.
Because many of the busshi had the name with the letter En, the school was named so afterward.
